page.title: 18Transport-water,roads,train
page.content: The A376 dominates the block,running to Exmouth from Exeter.This busy,commuter route,skirting the villages,runs parallel to the estuary.There is great pressure on this road during morning and evening rush-hours.Heavy lorries taking animal feed from Exmouth Docks add to the volume of traffic on this narrow,winding road.Trade in Exmouth Docks has greatly increased since 1980 and there is little likelihood of the problem easing. The Exmouth-Exeter line is a branch of the main Paddington-Penzance route.It runs right beside the estuary,giving lovely views which change with the tide It was opened in 1861 and has been threatened with closure.The route is kept open by commuters and Marines.
